projectPurpose: To provide a robust, open-source, and modular infrastructure for indexing various meta-protocols built on top of the Bitcoin blockchain, such as BRC-20, Runes, Bitmaps, and others.
mainFeatures: Open-source indexing client for Bitcoin meta-protocols
Modular design for extending with different meta-protocols
Includes modules for BRC-20, Bitmap, and SNS (with more planned)
Modules are built with reorg protection

alternatives.name: Hiro Systems Bitcoin Indexer / Ordinals API
mainFeatures: Provides REST APIs for data access

alternatives.name: UniSat API
mainFeatures: Provides access to BRC-20 and Ordinals data
Integrated with UniSat wallet and marketplace

alternatives.name: SRC Protocol Indexer
mainFeatures: Indexes SRC-20, SRC-721, and SRC-101 (Bitcoin Stamps)

marketPositioning: OPI positions itself as a comprehensive, modular, and open-source indexing client specifically designed to handle the increasing diversity of meta-protocols emerging on the Bitcoin blockchain. By building on the foundational 'ord' indexer and offering a modular architecture, it aims to be a versatile tool for indexing various protocols like BRC-20, Runes, and others. Its open-source nature differentiates it from proprietary API providers, while its focus on multiple meta-protocols and the inclusion of a light client option distinguish it from indexers focused on a single protocol.
